intro: Chionanthus macrophyllus, commonly known as the large-leaf chionanthus, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its showy, white, fragrant flowers that appear in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are typically 5–10 inches long and have a smooth, dark green upper surface. Its flowering period makes it a valuable addition to gardens for its ornamental value. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
